name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about South Dakota research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your South Dakota ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for South Dakota ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for South Dakota research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic South Dakota research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic South Dakota Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for South Dakota ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step South Dakota Research, 1880-Present

  3. Watch this video for ideas on South Dakota research.

    ☆ FS—United States Research: Great Plains Region - South Dakota—1:39

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for South Dakota research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—South Dakota Resources
    ☆ AC—South Dakota State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the South Dakota Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—South Dakota Record Finder

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in South Dakota in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for South Dakota

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in South Dakota in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of South Dakota

choices.name: Learn about South Dakota state history.

text:
1. Explore South Dakota historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—South Dakota History

  2. Explore South Dakota history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of South Dakota

  3. Learn about South Dakota history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ South Dakota History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about South Dakota archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about South Dakota archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about South Dakota archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Dakota Archives and Libraries
    ☆ South_Dakota State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore South Dakota Dept. of Archives collection.
  3. Explore Univ. of South Dakota Archives collection.
  4. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for South Dakota genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  5. Search for ☆free online books on South Dakota research on the FamilySearch site.
  6. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find South Dakota ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about South Dakota city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Dakota Directories

  2. Sites: Explore South Dakota city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore South Dakota city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore South Dakota ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for South Dakota city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

  2. Explore links for vital records on the South Dakota Public Health site.

  4. Explore South Dakota birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for South Dakota vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or South Dakota County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for South Dakota.

text: 1. In FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your South Dakota research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the South Dakota Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the South Dakota Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the South Dakota Genealogy page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the SD Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for South Dakota.
Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about South Dakota research.
  2. Explore the South Dakota research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about South Dakota research.

choices.name: Learn about South Dakota genealogy societies.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in South Dakota in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: South Dakota Societies

  2. Explore the South Dakota Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore South Dakota genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in South Dakota.
